@fluxbase/sdk - v0.1.0

    • createClient

    Function createClient

    Fluxbase TypeScript SDK

    Example

    import { createClient } from '@fluxbase/sdk'

    const client = createClient({
      url: 'http://localhost:8080',
      auth: {
        token: 'your-token',
        autoRefresh: true,
        persist: true
      }
    })

    // Authentication
    const { user } = await client.auth.signIn({
      email: 'user@example.com',
      password: 'password'
    })

    // Database
    const { data, error } = await client
      .from('products')
      .select('*')
      .eq('category', 'electronics')
      .execute()

    // Realtime
    client.channel('table:public.products')
      .on('INSERT', (payload) => console.log('New product:', payload))
      .subscribe()

    // Storage
    await client.storage
      .from('avatars')
      .upload('user-123.png', file)
    • createClient(options: FluxbaseClientOptions): FluxbaseClient

      Create a new Fluxbase client instance

      This is the recommended way to initialize the Fluxbase SDK.

      Parameters

      • options: FluxbaseClientOptions

        Client configuration options

      Returns FluxbaseClient

      A configured Fluxbase client instance

      Example

      import { createClient } from '@fluxbase/sdk'

      const client = createClient({
        url: 'http://localhost:8080',
        auth: {
          token: 'your-jwt-token',
          autoRefresh: true,
          persist: true
        },
        timeout: 30000,
        debug: false
      })
      • Defined in src/client.ts:252
